title: Did Trump say in February 2020 that COVID-19 was more deadly than the flu?
subtitle: While the President repeatedly underestimated the importance of the CAVID-19 deadlines in public places, he acknowledged that he was more deadly than the flu in private places.
author: Dan Evon
vclaim: President Trump of the United States admitted that COVID-19 was more deadly than the flu in early February 2020, but continued to undervalue the epidemic as "e.g. flu" in public places.
